  • Glossary
Zuul
  • Service Administration
  • Drivers
  • Azure
  • View page source

Azureïƒ

Zuul can use Azure as a source for build nodes.

Before using the Azure driver, make sure you have created a service principal.

Two methods of authenticating the service principal are available: a shared secret or OIDC federation.

To use a shared secret: save the credential information in a JSON file. Follow the instructions at Azure CLI and use the --sdk-auth flag:

az ad sp create-for-rbac --name zuul --sdk-auth

There are two options for providing the information in this file to Zuul: place this file on the zuul-launcher and refer to it using <azure connection>.shared_credentials_file or extract the information in the file and provide it directly with the configuration options below.

To use OIDC federation, the JWT must be available in a file on the zuul-launcher (for example, by way of Kubernetes secret projection). Set the <azure connection>.subscription_id, <azure connection>.tenant_id, <azure connection>.client_id, and <azure connection>.federated_token_file fields.

You must also have created a network for Zuul to use. Be sure to enable IPv6 on the network if you plan to use it.

The Azure driver uses the â€œStandardâ€ SKU for all public IP addresses. Standard IP addresses block all incoming traffic by default, therefore the use of a Network Security Group is required in order to allow incoming traffic. You will need to create one, add any required rules, and attach it to the subnet created above.

You may also need to register the Microsoft.Compute resource provider with your subscription.

The azure driver adds the following options to the provider and section configurations:

Connection Configurationïƒ

The supported options in zuul.conf connections are:

<azure connection>ïƒ
<azure connection>.driver (required)ïƒ
azureïƒ

The connection must set driver=azure for Azure connections.

<azure connection>.shared_credentials_fileïƒ

A path to JSON file with shared access credentials. If this is supplied, no other credential settings need to be present.

<azure connection>.federated_token_fileïƒ

Path to the a file containing a JWT for use with OIDC federation.

<azure connection>.tenant_idïƒ

The Microsoft Entra tenant ID for the account. Required unless <azure connection>.shared_credentials_file is set.

<azure connection>.client_idïƒ

The Microsoft Entra client ID for the account. Required unless <azure connection>.shared_credentials_file is set.

<azure connection>.client_secret_idïƒ

The shared secret for the principal. Required unless <azure connection>.shared_credentials_file or <azure connection>.federated_token_file are set.

<azure connection>.subscription_idïƒ

The Azure subscription to use. Required unless <azure connection>.shared_credentials_file is set.

<azure connection>.rateïƒ
Default: 2

The API rate limit (in requests per second) to use when performing API calls with Azure.

Provider Configurationïƒ

The azure driver adds the following options to the provider and section configurations:

provider[azure]ïƒ
Type: dict

The attributes available for configuring an Azure provider are below.

provider[azure].abstractïƒ
Default: False
Type: bool

Whether a section is intended to be inherited by another section or a provider. This setting is currently unused (but may be used in the future). If a section is used to provide common values to other sections, set this to true. Otherwise, the default of false indicates that the section should be referenced directly by providers.

provider[azure].connectionïƒ
Type: str

The name of the connection to use. This attribute is only used by section objects.

provider[azure].flavor-defaultsïƒ
Type: dict

Attributes to be set as default values for any flavor used with this provider. Many attributes which may be set on an individual flavor may be set once in this section and used for all the flavors in this provider. Values set on individual flavors may still override the values set here.

provider[azure].flavor-defaults.ephemeral-diskïƒ
Type: bool

If set to true, Azure will create an ephemeral OS disk instead of a managed disk.

provider[azure].flavor-defaults.finalïƒ
Default: False

Whether the configuration of the flavor may be updated by values in flavor-defaults or overidden with a new definition by sections or providers lower in the hierarchy than the point at which the final attribute is applied.

Trueïƒ

The flavor may not be updated or overidden.

Falseïƒ

The flavor may be updated or overidden.

allow-overrideïƒ

The flavor may not be updated by flavor-defaults but may be explicitly overidden by redefining it in a new â€˜flavorâ€™ entry.

provider[azure].flavor-defaults.generate-passwordïƒ
Type: bool

If booting a Windows image, an administrative password is required. If the password is not actually used (e.g., the image has key-based authentication enabled), a random password can be provided by enabling this option. The password is not stored anywhere and is not retrievable.

provider[azure].flavor-defaults.public-ipv4ïƒ
Default: False
Type: bool

Whether a public IPv4 address should be attached to nodes.

provider[azure].flavor-defaults.public-ipv6ïƒ
Default: False
Type: bool

Whether a public IPv6 address should be attached to nodes.

provider[azure].flavor-defaults.userdataïƒ
Type: str

A string of userdata for a node. Systems such as â€œcloud-initâ€ may use this to configure the node on boot.

provider[azure].flavor-defaults.volume-sizeïƒ
Type: int

The size of the operating system disk, in GiB.

provider[azure].flavorsïƒ
Type: dict

A list of flavors associated with this provider.

provider[azure].flavors.descriptionïƒ
Type: str

A textual description of the image for reference purposes.

provider[azure].flavors.ephemeral-diskïƒ
Type: bool

If set to true, Azure will create an ephemeral OS disk instead of a managed disk.

provider[azure].flavors.finalïƒ
Default: False

Whether the configuration of the flavor may be updated by values in flavor-defaults or overidden with a new definition by sections or providers lower in the hierarchy than the point at which the final attribute is applied.

Trueïƒ

The flavor may not be updated or overidden.

Falseïƒ

The flavor may be updated or overidden.

allow-overrideïƒ

The flavor may not be updated by flavor-defaults but may be explicitly overidden by redefining it in a new â€˜flavorâ€™ entry.

provider[azure].flavors.generate-passwordïƒ
Type: bool

If booting a Windows image, an administrative password is required. If the password is not actually used (e.g., the image has key-based authentication enabled), a random password can be provided by enabling this option. The password is not stored anywhere and is not retrievable.

provider[azure].flavors.ipv4ïƒ
Default: False
Type: bool

Whether to enable IPv4 networking. Defaults to true unless IPv6 is enabled. Enabling this will attach a private IPv4 address.

provider[azure].flavors.ipv6ïƒ
Default: False
Type: bool

Whether to enable IPv6 networking. Enabling this will attach a private IPv6 address.

provider[azure].flavors.nameïƒ
Type: str

The name of the flavor. Used to refer to the flavor in Zuul configuration.

provider[azure].flavors.priorityïƒ
Default: regular

Whether to create regular or spot instances.

regularïƒ

A regular instance.

spotïƒ

A spot instance.

provider[azure].flavors.public-ipv4ïƒ
Default: False
Type: bool

Whether a public IPv4 address should be attached to nodes.

provider[azure].flavors.public-ipv6ïƒ
Default: False
Type: bool

Whether a public IPv6 address should be attached to nodes.

provider[azure].flavors.userdataïƒ
Type: str

A string of userdata for a node. Systems such as â€œcloud-initâ€ may use this to configure the node on boot.

provider[azure].flavors.vm-sizeïƒ
Type: str

Size of the VM to use in Azure. See the List of VM sizes for the list of sizes availabile in each region.

provider[azure].flavors.volume-sizeïƒ
Type: int

The size of the operating system disk, in GiB.

provider[azure].image-defaultsïƒ
Type: dict

Attributes to be set as default values for any image used with this provider. Many attributes which may be set on an individual image may be set once in this section and used for all the images in this provider. Values set on individual images may still override the values set here.

provider[azure].image-defaults.connection-portïƒ
Type: int

The port that Zuul should use when connecting to the node. For most nodes this is not necessary. This defaults to 22 when connection-type is â€˜sshâ€™ and 5986 when it is â€˜winrmâ€™.

provider[azure].image-defaults.connection-typeïƒ

The connection type that a consumer should use when connecting to the node.

winrmïƒ

A winrm connection.

sshïƒ

An ssh connection.

provider[azure].image-defaults.ephemeral-diskïƒ
Type: bool

If set to true, Azure will create an ephemeral OS disk instead of a managed disk.

provider[azure].image-defaults.finalïƒ
Default: False

Whether the configuration of the label may be updated by values in label-defaults or overidden with a new definition by sections or providers lower in the hierarchy than the point at which the final attribute is applied.

Trueïƒ

The label may not be updated or overidden.

Falseïƒ

The label may be updated or overidden.

allow-overrideïƒ

The label may not be updated by label-defaults but may be explicitly overidden by redefining it in a new â€˜labelâ€™ entry.

provider[azure].image-defaults.generate-passwordïƒ
Type: bool

If booting a Windows image, an administrative password is required. If the password is not actually used (e.g., the image has key-based authentication enabled), a random password can be provided by enabling this option. The password is not stored anywhere and is not retrievable.

provider[azure].image-defaults.import-timeoutïƒ
Default: 300
Type: int

The limit on the amount of time a successful image import can take.

provider[azure].image-defaults.python-pathïƒ
Type: str

The path of the default python interpreter. Used by Zuul to set ansible_python_interpreter. The special value auto will direct Zuul to use inbuilt Ansible logic to select the interpreter.

provider[azure].image-defaults.shell-typeïƒ
Type: str

The shell type of the nodeâ€™s default shell executable. Used by Zuul to set ansible_shell_type. This setting should only be used

  • For a windows image with the experimental connection-type ssh in which case cmd or powershell should be set and reflect the nodeâ€™s DefaultShell configuration.

  • If the default shell is not Bourne compatible (sh), but instead e.g. csh or fish, and the user is aware that there is a long-standing issue with ansible_shell_type in combination with become.

provider[azure].image-defaults.tagsïƒ
Type: dict

A dictionary of tags to add to uploaded images, and to nodes created from them. Avoid the use of zuul_ as a key prefix since Zuul uses this for internal values.

provider[azure].image-defaults.upload-methodsïƒ
Default: ['copy', 'import', 'upload']
Type: list

An ordered list of methods to use when creating an image in the provider.

copyïƒ

Copy the image from another provider if available.

importïƒ

Import the image directly from its storage location.

uploadïƒ

Download the image from its storage location and upload it to the provider.

provider[azure].image-defaults.userdataïƒ
Type: str

A string of userdata for a node. Systems such as â€œcloud-initâ€ may use this to configure the node on boot.

provider[azure].image-defaults.usernameïƒ
Type: str

The username Zuul should use when connecting to the node.

provider[azure].image-defaults.volume-sizeïƒ
Type: int

The size of the operating system disk, in GiB.

A list of images associated with this provider.

Whether the configuration of the label may be updated by values in label-defaults or overidden with a new definition by sections or providers lower in the hierarchy than the point at which the final attribute is applied.

If booting a Windows image, an administrative password is required. If the password is not actually used (e.g., the image has key-based authentication enabled), a random password can be provided by enabling this option. The password is not stored anywhere and is not retrievable.

provider[azure].images[cloud].image-filterïƒ
Type: dict

Specifies a private image to use via filters. Either this field, provider[azure].images[cloud].shared-gallery-image, provider[azure].images[cloud].community-gallery-image, provider[azure].images[cloud].image-reference, or provider[azure].images[cloud].image-id must be provided.

If a filter is provided, Zuul will list all of the images in the providerâ€™s resource group and reduce the list using the supplied filter. All items specified in the filter must match in order for an image to match. If more than one image matches, the images are sorted by name and the last one matches.

The following filters are available:

provider[azure].images[cloud].image-filter.locationïƒ
Type: str

The image location.

provider[azure].images[cloud].image-filter.nameïƒ
Type: str

The image name.

provider[azure].images[cloud].image-filter.tagsïƒ
Type: dict

The image tags.

provider[azure].images[cloud].image-idïƒ
Type: str

Specifies a private image to use by ID. Either this field, provider[azure].images[cloud].shared-gallery-image, provider[azure].images[cloud].community-gallery-image, provider[azure].images[cloud].image-reference, or provider[azure].images[cloud].image-filter must be provided.

provider[azure].images[cloud].image-referenceïƒ
Type: dict

Specifies a public image to use by reference. Either this field, provider[azure].images[cloud].shared-gallery-image, provider[azure].images[cloud].community-gallery-image, provider[azure].images[cloud].image-id, or provider[azure].images[cloud].image-filter must be provided.

provider[azure].images[cloud].image-reference.offerïƒ
Type: str

The image offer.

provider[azure].images[cloud].image-reference.publisherïƒ
Type: str

Type: str

provider[azure].label-defaultsïƒ
Type: dict

Attributes to be set as default values for any label used with this provider. Many attributes which may be set on an individual label may be set once in this section and used for all the labels in this provider. Values set on individual labels may still override the values set here.

provider[azure].label-defaults.boot-timeoutïƒ
Default: 300
Type: int

The time (in seconds) to wait for a node to boot.

provider[azure].label-defaults.ephemeral-diskïƒ
Type: bool

If set to true, Azure will create an ephemeral OS disk instead of a managed disk.

provider[azure].label-defaults.executor-zoneïƒ
Type: str

Specify that a Zuul executor in the specified zone is used to run jobs with nodes from this label.

provider[azure].label-defaults.finalïƒ
Default: False

Whether the configuration of the label may be updated by values in label-defaults or overidden with a new definition by sections or providers lower in the hierarchy than the point at which the final attribute is applied.

Trueïƒ

The label may not be updated or overidden.

Falseïƒ

The label may be updated or overidden.

allow-overrideïƒ

The label may not be updated by label-defaults but may be explicitly overidden by redefining it in a new â€˜labelâ€™ entry.

provider[azure].label-defaults.generate-passwordïƒ
Type: bool

If booting a Windows image, an administrative password is required. If the password is not actually used (e.g., the image has key-based authentication enabled), a random password can be provided by enabling this option. The password is not stored anywhere and is not retrievable.

provider[azure].label-defaults.host-key-checkingïƒ
Default: True
Type: bool

Whether to validate SSH host keys. When true, this helps ensure that nodes are ready to receive SSH connections before they are used. When set to false, Zuul will not attempt to ssh-keyscan nodes after they are booted. Disable this if the zuul-launcher and the nodes it launches are on different networks, where the launcher is unable to reach the nodes directly.

provider[azure].label-defaults.key-dataïƒ
Type: str

The SSH public key that should be installed on the node.

provider[azure].label-defaults.max-ageïƒ
Default: 0
Type: int

The time (in seconds) since creation that a node may be available for use. Ready nodes older than this time will be deleted.

provider[azure].label-defaults.max-ready-ageïƒ
Default: 0
Type: int

The time (in seconds) an unassigned node should stay in ready state.

provider[azure].label-defaults.min-retention-timeïƒ
Default: 0
Type: int

The time (in seconds) since an instance was launched, during which a node will not be deleted. For node resources with minimum billing times, this can be used to ensure that the instance is retained for at least the minimum billing interval.

This setting takes precedence over max-[ready-]age.

provider[azure].label-defaults.reuseïƒ
Default: False
Type: bool

Should the node be reused (True) or deleted (False) after use.

provider[azure].label-defaults.slotsïƒ
Default: 1
Type: int

How many jobs are permitted run on the same node simultaneously.

provider[azure].label-defaults.snapshot-expirationïƒ
Default: 604800
Type: int

The time (in seconds) until a snapshot expires.

provider[azure].label-defaults.snapshot-timeoutïƒ
Default: 3600
Type: int

The time (in seconds) to wait for a snapshot to complete.

provider[azure].label-defaults.subnet-idïƒ
Type: str

Specifies the subnet to use by ID.

provider[azure].label-defaults.subnet-referenceïƒ
Type: dict

Specifies the subnet to use by reference

provider[azure].label-defaults.subnet-reference.networkïƒ
Type: str

The name of the subnetâ€™s network.

provider[azure].label-defaults.subnet-reference.resource-groupïƒ
Type: str

The resource group that contains the subnet.

provider[azure].label-defaults.subnet-reference.subnetïƒ
Default: default
Type: str

The name of the subnet.

provider[azure].label-defaults.tagsïƒ
Type: dict

A dictionary of tags to add to nodes. Avoid the use of zuul_ as a key prefix since Zuul uses this for internal values.

Type: bool

If booting a Windows image, an administrative password is required. If the password is not actually used (e.g., the image has key-based authentication enabled), a random password can be provided by enabling this option. The password is not stored anywhere and is not retrievable.

provider[azure].labels.host-key-checkingïƒ
Default: True
Type: bool

Whether to validate SSH host keys. When true, this helps ensure that nodes are ready to receive SSH connections before they are used. When set to false, Zuul will not attempt to ssh-keyscan nodes after they are booted. Disable this if the zuul-launcher and the nodes it launches are on different networks, where the launcher is unable to reach the nodes directly.

provider[azure].labels.imageïƒ
Type: str

The image to use with this label.

provider[azure].labels.key-dataïƒ
Type: str

The SSH public key that should be installed on the node.

provider[azure].labels.max-ageïƒ
Default: 0
Type: int

The time (in seconds) since creation that a node may be available for use. Ready nodes older than this time will be deleted.

provider[azure].labels.max-ready-ageïƒ
Default: 0
Type: int

The time (in seconds) an unassigned node should stay in ready state.

provider[azure].labels.min-readyïƒ
Default: 0
Type: int

Minimum number of instances that should be in a ready state. Zuul always creates more nodes as necessary in response to demand, but setting min-ready can speed processing by attempting to keep nodes on-hand and ready for immedate use. This is best-effort based on available capacity and is not a guaranteed allocation. The default of 0 means that Zuul will only create nodes of this label when there is demand.

provider[azure].labels.min-retention-timeïƒ
Default: 0
Type: int

The time (in seconds) since an instance was launched, during which a node will not be deleted. For node resources with minimum billing times, this can be used to ensure that the instance is retained for at least the minimum billing interval.

This setting takes precedence over max-[ready-]age.

provider[azure].labels.nameïƒ
Type: str

The name of the label. Used to refer to the label in Zuul configuration.

provider[azure].labels.reuseïƒ
Default: False
Type: bool

Should the node be reused (True) or deleted (False) after use.

provider[azure].labels.slotsïƒ
Default: 1
Type: int

How many jobs are permitted run on the same node simultaneously.

provider[azure].labels.snapshot-expirationïƒ
Default: 604800
Type: int

The time (in seconds) until a snapshot expires.

provider[azure].labels.snapshot-timeoutïƒ
Default: 3600
Type: int

The time (in seconds) to wait for a snapshot to complete.

Type: str

Specifies the subnet to use by ID.

provider[azure].launch-attemptsïƒ
Default: 3
Type: int

The number of times to attempt launching a node before considering the request failed.

provider[azure].launch-timeoutïƒ
Type: int

The time to wait from issuing the command to create a new node until the node is reporting as running. If the timeout is exceeded, the node launch is aborted and the node deleted.

provider[azure].nameïƒ
Type: str

The name of the provider. Used to refer to the provider in Zuul configuration.

provider[azure].parentïƒ
Type: str

The name of the parent section from which to inherit. This attribute is only used by section objects. To indicate which section a provider should be attached to, use provider[azure].section

provider[azure].regionïƒ
Type: str

Name of the Azure region to use.

provider[azure].resource-groupïƒ
Type: str

Name of the resource group in which to place nodes.

provider[azure].resource-limitsïƒ
Type: dict

Resource limits for this provider. Configure these values to cause Zuul to attempt to limit the resource usage. This can be used to limit Zuulâ€™s usage to a level below the cloud quota.

provider[azure].resource-limits.coresïƒ
Type: int

The number of cores used by regular instances.

provider[azure].resource-limits.instancesïƒ
Type: int

The number of instances.

provider[azure].resource-limits.lowPriorityCoresïƒ
Type: int

The number of low priority cores (including spot instances).

provider[azure].resource-limits.ramïƒ
Type: int

The amount of ram, in MiB.

provider[azure].sectionïƒ
Type: str

The name of the section from which to inherit.
